document.docAuthor: Ishikawa, Tadashi, Cai, Wanzhi & Tomokuni, Masaaki
document.docTitle: Abelocephala araiorum Ishikawa, Cai & Tomokuni, 2015, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The assassin bug subfamily Tribelocephalinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Japan, with descriptions of eight new species in the genera Opistoplatys and Abelocephala

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The assassin bug subfamily Tribelocephalinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) from Japan, with descriptions of eight new species in the genera Opistoplatys and Abelocephala

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. This species is recognized by the following combination of character states: body approximately 3 mm long; head 1.6 to 1.7 times longer than width across eyes; mandibular plate nearly right-angled at anterior corner and weakly projected anteriorly in dorsal view; posterior pronotal lobe brownish yellow; outer (larger) cell of hemelytral membrane acutely angled apically; and posterior process of pygophore wide with weakly curved apical margin in dorsal view.

Pronotum (
Fig. 43
) approximately 0.8 times as long as humeral width; anterior lobe 0.7 times as long as posterior lobe along midline, 0.7 times as wide as humeral width. Hemelytron (
Figs. 43
, 115 ) wide, twice as long as its maximum width, exceeding apex of abdomen by approximately 0.3 times of its length; outer (larger) cell of membrane (
Fig. 115
) acutely angled apically.

Holotype
. ♂ (
Fig. 43
), “[ JAPAN ] Kubura-dake, Yonaguni-jima Is., Ryûkyû Islands,
9–12 . IX. 2004
, FIT, Koji & Shiho Arai” ( LETUA IC 2014 -00128) ( TUA ).

Paratypes
(
4 ♂
, 2 ♀). JAPAN [Yonaguni Is.] Mt. Kubura-dake:
2 ♂
(one shown in
Figs. 121
, 127, 133, 139), 1 ♀ ( Figs. 44 , 66 , 77 ,
90– 92
, 145 , 150 ),
16 .vi. 2001
, S. Arai ( LETUA IC 2014 -00129–00131) ( TUA , CAU ),
1 ♂
( Figs. 55, 56 , 71 ,
87– 89
, 115 ),
28 .iv.– 2 .v. 2004
, FIT-M, T. Ishikawa et al . ( LETUA IC 2014 -00132) ( TUA ), 1 ♀,
10 .ix. 2004
, K. & S. Arai ( LETUA IC 2014 -00133) ( TUA ),
1 ♂
, same data as holotype ( LETUA IC 2014 -00134) ( NSMT ).
Etymology. Named after Mr. Koji Arai and his wife Shiho, who collected the type specimens of this species; a noun in the genitive case.

Abelocephala araiorum
sp. nov.
was collected from FIT-Ms placed on the forest floor and by using a Tullgren funnel. These observations suggest that, similar to
A . albula
sp. nov.
, this new species is a ground inhabitant.
